title: Revising a Classic Butterfly Mimicry Scenario: Demonstration of Mullerian Mimicry between Florida Viceroys (Limenitis archippus floridensis) and Queens (Danaus gilippus berenice)
Thermal stability of Langmuir‐Blodgett and self‐assembled films: A possible scenario for order–disorder transitions
items.abstract: <jats:p><jats:bold>Review: The effective design of stable, ordered organic superlattices</jats:bold> is assisted by a thorough understanding of enthalpy and entropy contributions and molecular interactions in two dimensions. Important information in this respect can be obtained by studying the thermal stability of monolayers of long‐chain organic amphiphiles. Work on both LB and SA films is reviewed and a possible explanation for thermally‐induced structural events (e.g. order–disorder transitions, see figure) in molecular assemblies discussed.</jats:p><jats:p><jats:boxed-text content-type="graphic" position="anchor"><jats:graphic xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" mimetype="image/gif" position="anchor" specific-use="enlarged-web-image" xlink:href="graphic/must001.gif"><jats:alt-text>magnified image</jats:alt-text></jats:graphic></jats:boxed-text></jats:p>

title: REVISING A CLASSIC BUTTERFLY MIMICRY SCENARIO: DEMONSTRATION OF MÜLLERIAN MIMICRY BETWEEN FLORIDA VICEROYS (LIMENITIS ARCHIPPUS FLORIDENSIS) AND QUEENS (DANAUS GILIPPUS BERENICE)
Measurable properties of the standard Z0 in aSU(2) L * ×SU(2)L×U(1) Y scenario
